Are cigars a commodity for the masses, or a luxury for the privileged? If you have to travel to Nassau, Bahamas to the Graycliff Hotel and Restaurant to get a specific cigar, undoubtedly that cigar is a luxury. Fortunately those of us in the masses can take moments of privilege and enjoy an extraordinary product like a Graycliff Cigar.

Reviewed October 14, 2007. We went to Graycliff based on the repuation of the food, wine cellar, and cigars. All of them were wonderful! If you are a lover of wine, ask for a tour of the wine cellar. Amazing! The owners are such characters - stop to chat with them when you are there. They are very hands-on, and have lived there for ages.

Cigar reviews, cigar tasting notes, cigar forums, cigar chat, and other cigar related information. How to Store Your Prized Cigars. Cigars were born in the tropics where the temperature is always warm, and the humidity was always high. Cigars like to live in an environment much like they were born in. The way to simulate that environment is with a humidor.

The aroma or bouquet of a cigar truly depends upon the origins of the tobacco leaves and or whatever is rolled with it. A majority of the smell is based on the wrapper leaf of the cigar. Burning tobacco leaves can smell like many things. As burning produces carbon, this is the first aromatic. The following smells are a true derivative of where the leaves were grown. The fields of the Connecticut River Valley or the Vuelta Abajo of Cuba.

Cigar Cases. A humidor is great for long-term stogie storage, but if you''re stepping out of the house with a couple precious puros, cigar cases are where it''s at. Cigar cases offer a distinct advantage over merely sticking your cigars in your shirt pocket or center console. For starters, some are actually crushproof enough to withstand a dump truck.

Although cigars can be safer than cigarettes, many cigar smokers enjoy little to no decrease in risk. Based on the existing research, the landmark 1964 surgeon general's report on smoking and health pointed to the dangers of cigarettes and excused cigars and pipes as much less dangerous than cigarettes.

SEASONING A HUMIDOR. It takes time, patience and a little know-how to get a new humidor ready to hold cigars. You're trying to recreate the tropical environments where most cigars are made, and you can't rush the process. Putting cigars into a dry humidor can ruin good smokes.

Cigars were born in the tropics where the temperature is always warm, and the humidity was always high. Cigars like to live in an environment much like they were born in. The way to simulate that environment is with a humidor.

The cigar plant flower grows in zones 9b-12 year round, but can grow as an annual in other areas. When growing cigar plants as an annual in cooler zones, the blooms appear in summer. In the more tropical areas where it is hardy, cigar plants bloom off and on all year round.

Most common in cigar bars or stores. One room is built as or converted to a humidor where all the cigars are stored. Cabinet. Usually placed on the floor as a piece of furniture.
